message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting symptoms of paranoid schizophrenia, which is treated with antipsychotics such as risperidone. Sertraline is an antidepressant and is not indicated in this case. Chlorpromazine is also an antipsychotic but has a higher risk of side effects compared to risperidone. Psychotherapy alone is usually not enough to treat schizophrenia, although it may be used as an adjunct to medication.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a psychotic disorder and among the options, only Risperidone is an antipsychotic medication used to treat such disorders. Sertraline is an antidepressant, Chlorpromazine is also an antipsychotic medication but not commonly used in the US, and psychotherapy may be helpful but not as a first-line treatment for acute psychosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest schizophrenia or a related disorder, and antipsychotic medications like Risperidone are used to treat these disorders. Sertraline is an SSRI used to treat depression and anxiety, not psychosis. Chlorpromazine is also an antipsychotic but is less commonly used due to its more severe side effects. Psychotherapy can be useful in conjunction with medication but is not sufficient as the only treatment for schizophrenia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is presenting with symptoms of psychosis, specifically auditory hallucinations and delusions. Risperidone is an antipsychotic medication that can be effective in treating these symptoms. Sertraline is an antidepressant and would not be effective in treating psychosis. Chlorpromazine is also an antipsychotic but is less commonly used due to its adverse effects. Psychotherapy may be helpful in conjunction with medication, but it is not typically used as the sole treatment for psychosis.

Sertraline is an antidepressant and not indicated for treating psychotic symptoms. Chlorpromazine can also be used for treating psychosis but it has a higher risk of side effects. Psychotherapy alone may not be sufficient to treat this level of psychosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting symptoms of schizophrenia, including auditory hallucinations and delusions, and risperidone is an antipsychotic medication commonly used to treat these symptoms. Sertraline is an antidepressant and would not be effective in treating the patient's specific symptoms. Chlorpromazine is also an antipsychotic medication, but risperidone is generally preferred due to less risk of side effects. Psychotherapy is a valuable adjunct to medication treatment but alone would not be enough to address the patient's symptoms in this acute setting.

Risperidone is an antipsychotic medication that can target these symptoms, while the other options are not effective for treating psychosis. Psychotherapy may be helpful as an adjunctive treatment, but alone is unlikely to be effective in managing severe psychotic symptoms like those exhibited by the patient.

Chlorpromazine is another antipsychotic but is not commonly used due to its side effects. Psychotherapy can be helpful but is not the first-line treatment for acute psychosis.

Sertraline is an antidepressant, and chlorpromazine is also an anti-psychotic but is not commonly used due to its side effect profile.
